decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of colors to maximize aggression and efficiency in combat. By including Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck gains access to additional resources and versatility. With a mix of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Territorial Kavu, along with impactful spells like Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and decisively. The use of Leyline Binding helps control the board while maintaining pressure. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure victory through relentless aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Mishra's Bauble to power out large creatures like Hollow One and Nethergoyf. It also utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push for removal while also having access to powerful threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ox of Agonas. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game with aggressive plays and high-powered creatures, overwhelming them before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through cards and use cascade abilities to cast Living End, a powerful sorcery that allows the player to return all creature cards from their graveyard to the battlefield, essentially wiping the opponent's board while bringing back their own creatures. The deck includes cards that can help dig for Living End, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and protect the combo with counterspells. By efficiently cycling cards and setting up the right board state, the player can overwhelm their opponent with a huge army of creatures on the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, while also being able to draw through the deck with cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible. This enables the player to set up a powerful combo with Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. The deck also utilizes Wrenn's Resolve to protect key combo pieces and push through the final bit of damage needed for victory.

This deck utilizes a variety of creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of options for the player, allowing them to adapt to different situations and opponents. By combining creature tutoring effects with sacrifice and death triggers, the deck aims to generate value and control the board while setting up for powerful combo plays. The key strategy revolves around efficiently using creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to build advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a win through proactive creature interaction and combo finishers.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard while also generating value through discard effects. The deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Orcish Bowmasters. By combining disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Waste Not with powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of Underworld Breach allows for potential combo plays and graveyard recursion to maintain a constant stream of threats.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand and resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, eventually overwhelming them with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also utilizes Necrodominance to bring back key creatures from the graveyard and Soul Spike as a finisher. In addition, the deck includes some removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to deal with threats. The goal is to control the game and outvalue the opponent until victory is achieved.
